ADDITIONAL DIAGNOSIS : BIPOLAR DISORDER . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : This is a 53 year old white female with a history of bipolar disorder who had been maintained on lithium and Clozaril in the past . Several months ago , the patient had a decreased white blood cell count and the clozaril was stopped . She was restarted on the clozaril recently and the dose was being titrated to her white blood cell count using olanzapine in addition . She received a decreased dose of clozaril from 450 mg per day to 350 mg per day . The white blood cell count dropped again from 3.6 to 2.9 . Again the clozaril was stopped . On the day of admission , the patient had a temperature to 101 without any localizing symptoms but was not feeling well , had a dry cough , mild frontal headache and was therefore admitted for pancytopenia . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Pulmonary embolus 3 to 4 years ago . Bi-polar disorder . Eczema . Constipation . ALLERGIES : No known drug allergies . MEDICATIONS : Olanzapine 30 mg p.o. q.h.s. , lithium 300 mg p.o. q.d. , vitamin E 400 units q.d. , aspirin 81 mg p.o. q.d. , calcium supplementation . SOCIAL HISTORY : She lives with a female friend . She does not drink alcohol or smoke tobacco or take drugs . She is not sexually active . FAMILY HISTORY : Her mother had a bypass at the age of 70 . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : Temperature 101.2 , respiratory rate 16 , heart rate is 98 , blood pressure 107/70 , O2 sat of 98% on room air . She was a nontoxic appearing white female . Her oropharynx was benign . Neck was supple . Chest was clear to auscultation . Cardiovascular - Revealed a jugular venous pressure at 3 cm , 2+ carotids . Regular rate and rhythm , normal S1 and S2 with no murmurs , rubs or gallops . Abdomen was benign . Rectal - No masses or fluctuations . She had guaiac negative brown stool . LABORATORY DATA : WBC of 1.54 , absolute neutrophil count of 1200 , platelets of 109 , hematocrit was 33.8 . The patient was admitted and followed for pancytopenia and fevers . Her clozaril of course was held and because of some symptoms of cough and headache was started on Biaxin . On hospital day # 3 , the patient was afebrile , feeling much better .
